page.title: 01HOBKIRK-AN INTRODUCTION.
page.content: Our block encompasses most of {Bonchester Bridge}village,some scattered housing and several farms. The character of the area is mainly farming,although many people travel into{Hawick},12 Km.away,to work.Until about ten years ago,many local people were employed by the Forestry Commission,but this has much decreased The landscape is hilly,and much of the building is on the flat land near the Rulewater,the river which runs through the block.Most of the hillsides are only useful for grazing,but flatter land is used to grow barley, turnips and grass for winter feed,stored as hay or silage.Recent years have seen a change from worker-occupied cottages to more holiday or retirement homes. A shift in population has brought many new families to the district in the last 20 years.
